newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-ITALY'S REGGIANA NAME ODDO AS NEW COACH.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ITALY'S REGGIANA NAME ODDO AS NEW COACH.

text.p: Francesco Oddo, a Sicilian coach who has never worked with a serie A side before, took over at bottom-of-the-table Reggiana on Tuesday after Romanian Mircea Lucescu was sacked by the Italians.
The club said Oddo, a former coach of serie B sides Avellino, Modena and Pescara, had signed a two-year contract and would lead his first training session on Wednesday.
Reggiana were promoted from serie B at the end of last season when current Parma coach Carlo Ancelotti was at the helm. They decided to replace Lucescu on Monday.

The provincial northern club stands out as the only serie A team yet to win a match this season despite having several international stars such as Colombia's Adolfo "The Train" Valencia and Romanian Ioan Sabau.
They have just four points from 10 games and are firmly embedded in the floor of the division with only nine goals to their credit -- the lowest tally in serie A.
Lucescu, who arrived in Italy from Dinamo Bucharest in 1990 when he took over as coach of Pisa, has been dismissed three times in seven years in Italian soccer.
Pisa fired him in 1991 and he moved to Brescia, where he stayed in charge until 1995.
He was the second serie A coach to lose his job this season after Cagliari's Uruguayan Gregorio Perez in October.
